Name: Comb in the form of an antelope
Description: The Egyptians used wooden combs with spaced teeth to care for the wigs made from horsehair. One distinguishes single and double combs, according to whether the teeth are made on one side of the central part or both sides. This comb is of the single type. It is decorated with the figure of a ornate antelope. The motion of the animal rising to its feet is an old iconographic image of the Memphite tombs dating from the Old Kingdom.
